comments.body: I like the idea, maybe make it a extremely rare though
Good idea! I think that maybe the skulls could actually be skeletons in hiding that pop out when you get close.
that not Catacombs is Tombs
and java please
Kinda similar to SystemZee's idea but with unique ideas. What mobs would we find? Maybe these should spawn in the end or Nether? What unique loot would we find in this obviously rare structure?

maybe a type of illeger like a worshipper

and the loot woild be like the loot in a nether fortress

If a player wants to move to a new base beyond of 50000 blocks away from the world spawn point, he will find no strongholds close. It would be a great addition to overworld, making it accessible to the end dimention everywhere.

I think more strongholds in the world is necessary as some players in multiplayer have bases as far out as millions of blocks. it is good to hold on to the ring based generation and make it generate much more rare in outer rings. for example in the 4th ring there are 15 strongholds and average distance between them is 4226 blocks as the radius of the ring is 11264blocks.

now if radius of each ring would increase exponentially and number of strongholds had linear increase, then still there would be many strongholds near the origin and much less would generate at far distances.

for example at 1 million distance if we had 40 strongholds then the distance between them was 156,000 blocks which is quite rare but it is much easier for players to get to a stronghold as they would only need to travel a 78,000 blocks at max instead of 1,000,000 block, which would allow for much more world exploration and better access to the end for them.
Can you do to hatch in pocket edition the ender dragon egg . That will be a improvement.
I agree with this idea. The frames should have the ability to be destroyed after the Ender Dragon is defeated as well, but don't drop any resources. Crafting recipe should be like this:

I feel like that would be a great idea, so you would still have to go to the stronghold first to get the materials and defeat the dragon like normally, but after that you have the chance to make your own portal with the right materials and place it where you want.

The recipe could be like this:
You have to go to the end to get the endstones, but also need 1 netherite ingot per frame, that way it isn't as easy to make. If it was only stuff from the end that you have to get then I feel like it would be too easy to make.

I think a good possible recipe could be:

ender pearl, air, ender pearl

end stone, nether star, end stone

end stone, end stone, end stone

The nether star would also make sense, so that it's hard enough not to be op, and it's a star (12 total) taking you to a space-like dimension.

I agree this would be very nice, ive even made some ideas.

Нормально
Хорошо придумано!
I was just about to write a post about that!  I like mrPuNcH18's idea besides the bell (that is for villages only) and the creeper head.

Hi there,

Please contain the suggestions within posts, and not just links. Thanks.
The suggestion is the title of the post. The explanation is on the Reddit post. I thought that was made clear, but apparently it wasn't.

Hiya!

I totally get what you're saying, as noted, we do like to keep all the content that people are voting on together, rather than asking our community to click on outside links (for example, perhaps reddit is blocked on someone's network). As a matter of courtesy to them, if you'd consider putting all the info people need inside the post, that would be fantastic for your fellow community members.

Thanks so much for your contribution!
It is fixed, thanks for bringing it to my attention. It didn't cross my mind some people might not be able/allowed to access Reddit.
Always glad to help, we just want to make sure everyone can see everyone's great ideas in the form they're meant to be seen in!

I like the idea of bone collecter villagers.  But that it would make it super easy to get emeralds considering bones cannot be sold to villagers.  So then people would hoard all their bones and sell it making easy emeralds.
I think they look fine right now.
Maybe the form of clusters of coral reef is natural and realistic,which is in the Bedrock and the most attractive to me.But please make it come to the Java and no dead corals!
That's a good idea
The pale woodland mansion looks like this:
I think that instead of a humongous mansion (like the already existing woodland mansion) it should be smaller run down and filled with creakings and other hostile mobs.
Yessss
Yaaaaaaassss plz.
Then let the villagers know how to drive boats, at least fishermen.
This is not very likely to be added to Minecraft. See https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360005029872-Previously-Considered-Suggestions
And what is the practical purpose of these dungeons? In addition, why do we need spawners, if for a long time mobs in a certain structure can appear on their own, like pillagers at outposts?
Awesome, but maybe a little op. Maybe instead we keep the old-style dungeons, with a rare chance of them being replaced with a massive dungeon like this idea?

This feels like a good idea but I agree with the person that said these should only be occasionally swapped in. Having a mega-dungeon generate every single time would be far too overpowered, but whenever you find one that's rarer it would feel much more rewarding than game-breakingly op.
Great idea and there one tree with out its own wood the azalea tree, would be nice if they get there own wood as well. Instead of oak

Yeah, I agree the forest could use more variety, however we have to still make sure that it is easy to gather wood, and make it controllable so people can fam them reliably. I DEFINITELY agree that Azalea needs its own wood, it feel like it is just a tree with fancy leaves, and not it’s own tree. Overall, great idea though! :)

At first i was not very happy with the wild update, since we would just be getting ancient city( dont get me wrong i love the deep dark gameplay design). But this improved when mangrove swamps, mud bricks and frog was added. Even though they were small changed , it felt somewhat like the wild update.

To me the wild update always meant new trees fauna and dynamic diversity in biomes. Addition of pre -historic/ancient trees that are rare to find in deep forests is a concept i would like to see implemented. A great example is the Banyan tree, its sheer scale would give players goosebumps upon stumbling. It could have suspicious sand and gravel scattered around it or any new mechanic corresponding to exploration. It would not regrow since its ancient. The banyan would be a really cool addition if its scale is same as irl.

Same with jungles. Please make variety in jungles like the bamboo forest patches.  Deep canopy jungles with massive trees of several types and not just a single type. Make the jungle mysterious and overgrown and add variety like small twisting rivers with packed mud river beds. The jungle would feel like a different place seperated from the world.
Yes yes yes yes! Terrific idea! They could also add a feature where blocks turned to their cracked variant over time and you need a hammer to fix it back!
Those would be some really long paths...

It should depend on if the distance is short enough for there to reasonably be paths and on the terrain not being too rough.
If it can't be traversed in a single day or less on horseback then it shouldn't be there, and likewise if it is interrupted by a steep mountain range. This keeps things reasonable both in the sense of consistent logic and in the sense of not being "overpowered".
Some ghost blocks could be 1 block spaces so you have to crawl to find it.

I really like the idea, but I think there is some more potential for these craters and meteorites. For example: these craters could have large meteorites composed of rare or new materials that could only be found at these sites; perhaps a new ore or block with useful properties? Also, this could merit the addition of a new mob that spawns in and around the craters. Maybe a golem-like rock creature or a flying space creature or both? These could make finding a crater / meteorite more worthwhile and exciting for players, as well as give a reason to seek out these structures. Just a thought...
I feel like we should not add more ores, we need to give the existing ones more purpose.
What if ancient debris and/or raw iron blocks can spawn in these? Maybe nether blocks spawn in these, as if they came from that world?

I like your idea! There could also be different mobs depending on the part of the forest, like scarier more aggressive mobs the deeper you go as trees start getting bigger and more passive mobs towards the edge of the forest where the young trees are.

I think that this is a good idea. Because sometimes when you want to give your friend a build from your worlds but can't give it to them, it makes it kind of sad. Also makes it disappointing when you build something incredible and you manage to build it on a kind of a dumpy world, and know what to use it best for. I really hope this idea becomes successful someday.

Currently, the Bedrock World Editor doesn't allow you to import structure schematics (such as .schem or other formats available in editors like Amulet).
It's also not possible to load another world to copy and paste structures, which limits the reuse of previously created content.
Your solution would import the entire map, right? If they added it that way, it would still be useless.
I agree its really hard for us builder's especially when creating big builds and importing it on our server or another world for a project.
Es muy buena idea
Yes berry god
This could be super cool
I love to see a Japanese house in Minecraft
end city is basically that, it's protected by shulkers and maybe hints that it was inhabited by endermen before they were endermen

eso son End cities, los aldeanos del end son los endermen y los ender golems son los shulkers, aunque estaría bien que añadieran intercambios con los endermen
